title: @Meddler So uhh any chance we can NOT Sejuani Master Yi?
body:
So basically as Cowsep is pointing out, Bloodrazor is completely horrible compared to Sated Devourer in every single way, plus the new even more expensive Rageblade has soo much AP that isn't really used by Yi (only on W). 
Any chance we can at least revert the Highlander nerf since Yi's about to be Sejuani'd?

replies.body: We've got a number of Devourer building junglers we're planning to look at once 6.9 has been out for a week or so, see how they've been affected and whether we should look at making changes to them given the new environment. Yi's one of those champs.

As a Shyvana main, I am actually happy that Devourer is gone because it might mean Top Lane Shyvana can once again be balanced without making Jungle Shyvana stupid strong. I think overall this will be better for the health of the champion and allow her to have more diversity/interactivity within her play.

Agreed, Devourer could be fairly feast or famine depending on whether you could get objectives or not, which didn't help Jungle Shyvana in having a healthy playstyle since I feel she already struggled with consistency depending on the enemy team comp.

Omg, yes, the reason I even like the idea of shyvana is that she can go top, but shes clearly nothing up there compared to jungle, I definitely want to see more shyvana top and none of this farm for 20 minutes while being 7/0 and lvl 17 at 30 mins into the game.

Yeah, came here to say this. Too bad they aren't giving buffs based on their predictions, yet again. It's getting ridiculous. They have so much data in their hands, they should know who will end up underpowered or overpowered. And if they don't how about they create a PBE for Europe so we can play in something more decent instead of 200+ ms? Maybe that would give them some valuable data so they can finally make some real changes instead of constantly just reacting to outliers.

> [{quoted}](name=PapaGreg21,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HAEZmOE5,comment-id=000a0002,timestamp=2016-04-29T19:32:53.952+0000)
>
> As a Shyvana main, I am actually happy that Devourer is gone because it might mean Top Lane Shyvana can once again be balanced without making Jungle Shyvana stupid strong. I think overall this will be better for the health of the champion and allow her to have more diversity/interactivity within her play.

You think they would buff Shyvana to that high of a point to counterbalance the item nerfs so she is viable top? I like her a lot but I think she needs a lot of help to fight the Trundle's, Shen's and Maokai's in top lane.

She can do very well against a few. I can't remember the matchups, but I've had a lot of success with Shyvana top. I think the only reason people struggle is they rush BotRK or Titanic Hydra, when sunfire is perfect for her in lane.
Are you at all concerned that "Sejuani'd" is a term that exists? Any plans to start rolling back previous nerfs once it becomes clear that the item was the problem?

I'm a Yi main and I'm happy devourer is being removed, but less happy that you guys gave him a crippling ult nerf one patch before. And it is crippling, it makes team fighting god awful, on a champion that was already notorious for being bad in team fights unless snowballed. Which he often was because on-hit and bruiser itemization (Steraks) are OP. The ult change doesn't solve that issue, it creates a new one after devourer is removed. 

His ganks are far more difficult to pull off and he has 3 - 4 seconds to burst down a target for his reset in team fight after accounting for time to reposition/flank and time in alpha, and he likely will eat cc after that. Since that scenario seems really unappealing, now his primary win condition is just split pushing, which is not a reliable win condition in higher elo.
It's even less reliable in lower elo. Teams don't know how to capitalize when you draw aggro. They just go off and play with their dicks in the jungle.
Yeah I hope so after you dumpstered him. What about junglers that use Devourer and other enchants? Like Nocturne and Udyr?
Nocturne is not a devourer jungler. He benefits so much from the early damage and CDR. Besides, full damage assassin Nocturne hasn't been good for a long while.

He also has one of the highest base attack speeds in the game, but didn't go sated because the phantom hit was awkward on him and he wants armour pen, which sated doesn't benefit from. There's no such thing as a "devourer jungler." They are auto-attack based junglers and they work with multiple enchants. There is not a single auto-attack based jungler that cannot be balanced around warrior, cinderhulk, or devourer. Whichever one is most popular depends on whatever is most optimal at the time from Riot's balancing.
What was the point in nerfing Yi if you were going to remove Devourer so soon after? Did you have completely different people working on these without communicating?

i dont think they originally planned to remove devourer, i think just after all this time and the farming jungle item just causing more issues than benefits it was time to axe the item concept. they are keeping the ghost hit thing in which is nice but now you gotta actually build for it with lackluster stats.

They did plan it. There was a red post last patch stating that they planned "significant changes" for guinsoos and devourer in 6.9.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Axes,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ApE4WjUg,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-04-09T00:36:43.516+0000)
>
> Both items have significant changes planned for the midseason patch.

Doh, my bad i forgot it was set up for changes a while back, but to be honest i dont think they originally did plan to remove devourer, i think it just got to a point where they decided ok lets just bring back madreds bloodrazor and get rid of the farming thing. there was probably a lot of discussion about it.
I'm just wondering why they don't change the bloodrazor effect to crit only or let the % scale with bonus AD.

Most junglers don't use crit. While the scaling on the % damage is interesting too I think it would be too powerful. Because percentage health damage is weaker early anyway (due to enemies having less health) instead of the item being steadily more powerful as the game goes on there would be this massive power curve which is hard to balance.

it will never be "crit" only unless they added crit to the item, there are some junglers who will build this item where a zeal item isn't useable at all for them. {{champion:266}} {{champion:102}} 
and scaling with bonus AD could be a thing, but it could cause a lot of issues as well. madreds bloodrazor has been removed twice from the game because it was too powerful, im honeslty not expecting any better from the 3rd time.

Because the Yi nerfs were for a completely different problem: an assassin able to build near full tank and still murder people. This just further cements the fact that if Yi wants to be hard to kill, he's gonna have a hard time killing other people.

So the solution is to simultaneously nerf AD Yi too? The E change made AD Yi much weaker too, not just tank or AP Yi. The next change they're doing... fucking with his resets and Highlander effect every Yi build.
So build full tank and murder people like... Ekko, Poppy, Sion, Darius, Garen, etc, etc...

> [{quoted}](name=Carnicore,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HAEZmOE5,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2016-04-29T19:25:04.486+0000)
>
> What was the point in nerfing Yi if you were going to remove Devourer so soon after? Did you have completely different people working on these without communicating?

the point is either you pick him or ban him. The way I see it is while devourer still exists nerfing Yi is temporary solution to the problem

I'll say it again, Meddler. You should take this opportunity to better alter Yi to fit the new assassin items. Please, remove the crit damage bonus from his Q and alter his scalings to fit it. Allow him to build raw AD, life steal and move speed like an assassin should and don't force him into this weird hybrid ADC build.

What about udyr? Any plans for him? I didn't bother building devourer on him(Runic echoes baby). But now that his base stats on R are so destroyed, I'd like to know if its gonna be possible to play him in high elo again?(d2 and beyond)
Bloodrazor seems a little weak atm, so I'd expect them to buff it. It'll probably bring back Tiger Udyr.

what about Udyr?
Is Udyr a Devourer building jungler in Riots View?
Also the Bloodrazor is way better on range champs than melee whats kinda unfair.
Ranged physical damage dealers having a jg enchant that's better for them feels fine to me. It's no different from other enchants being better on some champs.

So Cowsep (whom you might know as someone who's fairly dedicated to master yi) universally hates the new item, to the point hes playing other champions. When a one trick pony decides to rather play other champs than someone hes been playing since season 1. I'm feeling Yi already needs some love. @Meddler

What if you just got rid of the item thats causing the issues instead of making so many junglers dependent on it
o wait

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HAEZmOE5,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2016-04-29T18:26:47.757+0000)
>
> We've got a number of Devourer building junglers we're planning to look at once 6.9 has been out for a week or so, see how they've been affected and whether we should look at making changes to them given the new environment. Yi's one of those champs.

Is there any chance you're ever going to do that for Fiora, given that she's been performing terribly since her numbers and itemization were gutted?

Also, let me save you some time: Yi is going to be garbage with Bloodrazor because Bloodrazor is a garbage item (even if you disagree with this point, his DPS is going to be lower than it was with devourer, this isn't arguable), and because he isn't performing particularly well right now. In what world does giving weaker itemization to a jungler whose performance is already mediocre not going to make them underpowered?

Hey Meddler, as an Aatrox jungle devourer main. i was thinking, will Aatrox get a buff/rework soon? i feel that his kit has many aspects that make him a bad pick in his current form. His E has a pretty bad late game scaling and a rather long cooldown, His Q (being his only form of crowd control) has a really long cooldown and a far too small area for the knockup. His W and R are okay though, those abilities are the only reason why he can still hold off against the champions of the league. So, Meddler, is Aatrox included in the list? and will he get a rework/buff soon? Thanks :D

My 2 cents:

Aatrox, in his current state, is a huge problem. If they buff him a little he becomes incredibly bad for the game as a whole. A little bit of strength added here or there can tip him over the edge (like any auto-attack based champion) and when that happens everybody loses their shit because, due to his damage output and survivability, he becomes near impossible to deal with. One of the reasons they stopped his entire Q knocking enemies up was to cut "extraneous" power (or power they felt was not core to the champion) but they didn't give him a compensation buff. Long story short, they had to dumpster Aatrox like they had to with old Poppy and old Sion.

As for the rework Yorick and Urgot are the most in need. In the Mid Year update they're reworking mages, followed by (most likely according to Riot) assassins. Diving fighters may be next (which would include Aatrox, Xin Zhao, Vi etc) but it could also be tanks or a support subclass. You may be waiting a few more years for an Aatrox rework.
What about Kayle? She has not been in the meta for a while and the only optimal way to play her right now was in the jungle with devourer (+rageblade), do you count her as one of those champs?

1. She has been meta for ages, just not popular.
2. Her jungling was gutted when they nerfed phantom hit on ranged champions.
3. Because her passive is hybrid shredding, and this item gives attack speed and damage, she can play in the jungle without feeling the need to afk farm for a mediocre passive.
Please don't forget the other devourer champs. ;_;

Is the same also planned for Guinsoo's Rageblade?

From playing around with it on the PBE, the item currently can feel a bit underwhelming on melees with the loss of the unconditional AS from Recurve Bow. Meanwhile, it feels like it could have the potential to be broken on certain ranged champions (mainly {{champion:96}} {{champion:10}} ).
The same ranged champs it was used on before primarily. It won't be any more broken than before, probably much less so now, with the loss of the AoE effect.
Thanks for letting us know you'll be keeping an eye on Yi next patch :) now we know you guys won't forget him!
If I never see another master yi, it would be too soon.
I'm a bit sad because my friend used to jungle with master a lot, but honestly I'm just glad the devourer/guinsoo combination is gone... I hope to god the new guinsoo won't be too strong.

It has the sated devourer effect.

It's going to be bullshit.

I feel like people aren't realizing the entire thing about Yi and Sated was the attack speed and the fact it made his true damage INSANE. He destroyed anything and there wasn't much the enemies could do but build health, which was then chunked by the BotRK he'd have after the sated. They decided to make it to where he instead gets 3% max health per hit as phys damage. 

Honestly, I've already tried him on the PBE and he does perfectly fine. In fact, tank killing is hilarious. Bloodrazor does quite a lot of damage and it's enhanced by armor pen, which also enhances BotRK. The only actual loss here is Rageblade which has been causing many issues with Irelia and Jax on top of Yi. Just get a decent build like Bloodrazor->BotRK->Ghostblade if enemies aren't building too much armor or you're able to get to their backline, or go with Lord Dominikk's so anyone who has health items gets to be murdered because you'll have 3 items that say 'HAHA, SCREW YOUR HEALTH ITEMS'.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HAEZmOE5,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-04-29T04:18:11.942+0000)
>
> I feel like people aren't realizing the entire thing about Yi and Sated was the attack speed and the fact it made his true damage INSANE. He destroyed anything and there wasn't much the enemies could do but build health, which was then chunked by the BotRK he'd have after the sated. They decided to make it to where he instead gets 3% max health per hit as phys damage. 
> 
> Honestly, I've already tried him on the PBE and he does perfectly fine. In fact, tank killing is hilarious. Bloodrazor does quite a lot of damage and it's enhanced by armor pen, which also enhances BotRK. The only actual loss here is Rageblade which has been causing many issues with Irelia and Jax on top of Yi. Just get a decent build like Bloodrazor->BotRK->Ghostblade if enemies aren't building too much armor or you're able to get to their backline, or go with Lord Dominikk's so anyone who has health items gets to be murdered because you'll have 3 items that say 'HAHA, SCREW YOUR HEALTH ITEMS'.

What you don't understand is that Double Strike and Phantom Hit was applied every 2nd attack which means 3ple onhit damage. I got the feeling is that your problem is that not that Yi is overpowered but Yi is going to kill me or my tanks which he suppose to do. He is skirmisher not pure assassin. Does not have burst like other assassins like Zed, Fizz, Talon but he got high sustain damage like Fiora, Vayne and any other skirmisher. THere are many times you can end up 0-5-n Yi top so attack speed ain't the issue here

Crits > Flat Armor pen
i never build flat armor penetration since backline has no armor but black Cleaver that gives me % Armor Reduction. You can build tons of dmg and still dominate backline just fine. You can stack as much as Attack Speed as you want vs Nasus or any Tank but if you don't have % ARmor pen cause he is going to have 300 armor at least he will delete you and flat armor pen vs that wont help you
this is the items i would build on zed for instance
{{champion:238}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3158}} 
if you do 2000 damage with all your spells and crits at the same time all that damage will be stacked on his ult which will make it about 1000 damage + 100% AD on ult itself as it multiplies both physical and magical damage at the same time making it over 3000 mixed damage

PBE players are bad pretty much like normal cause things are to be tested there not to be competitive so don't judge champions and item strength based on PBE or Normal Games. I am pretty sure you can get 6 types of boots and dominate both PBE and NORMALS

It's only every 2nd hit AFTER you got off double strike once. 

Plus. Flat armor pen is best against the Backline who has no armor. A Cleaver by itself totals 25% of all armor and if the person has 100 armor, you're removing 25 armor. If it's a squishy backliner who only has about 50-70ish armor, a cleaver would only remove 12.5-17.5 armor, meaning a Ghostblade's 20 would be more substantial. Ghostblade is also an early pick up item anyways, typically a 2nd item after the new Bloodrazor so squishies will have maybe 50ish armor by the time you pick it up unless you're getting stomped. 50 armor, a Cleaver after 5 hits would reduce armor by 12.5, taking the 50 armor from about 1/3rd reduction to 37.5 armor with about 27%ish. The Ghostblade though bring it down to 30 armor which is 23% reduction, meaning you'd do more damage with the ghostblade, plus you'd get more AD off of it and a useful click on top of the fact that Ghostblade is much cheaper than a Cleaver.

Cleaver is good for late game, but you could also just use Lord Dominikk's for around the same amount of damage increase to squishies and even more against tanks since the new Bloodrazor does Physical so it'd be increased by that 15% Dominikk gives you against tankier targets.

You're crazy if you think he's gonna get Sejuani treatment.

This new enchantment is basically going to be his Blade of The Ruined King which is typically Master Yi's first item if he is in lane and not jungling.

So it's still going to be a hella lot effective, it still has the attack speed. So basically once he gets rageblade, he will still destroy people.

Devourer with no stacks does 30 magic damage on hit.

For bloodrazer to deal 30 physical damage on hit, a target needs 1,000 HP. Targets don't have 1,000 HP when you buy bloodrazer unless they built giant's belt/bami's cinder/cinderhulk. On top of that, targets have more armour than mr when you get bloodrazer, so it's still less damage. Sated devourer did on average 90 magic damage on hit (When accounting phantom hit). Bloodrazer needs to hit a 3k health target to deal that much in physical damage. Bloodrazer also costs 200 more gold.

It's far worse than devourer, even without the phantom hit it's usually less damage. Only thing it has going for it is that it benefits from armour pen, so if you have youmuu's or black cleaver, super late game it will deal more damage than devourer without phantom hit since most champs have at least 1 mr item since maw/merc scim are so popular.

Maybe it needs buffs, maybe not. The community does not know balance (#redditknowsbalance)
The point of this whole fiasco is that sated devourer was a huge balancing problem and was unhealthy for the game because of it's play pattern. Either you were bronze and wouldn't stack it until 25+ minutes or you were cowsep and would stack it in about 12. It was too inconsistent.

As I said, maybe they will buff it and it does seem a little weak at the moment, but it is far easier to balance than sated devourer.
Of course Bloodrazor isn't good compared to Sated because Sated is so horrendously broken on him
